rooms.name: Atop the Spire
rooms.description: Here stands a lonely spire which rises several hundred meters above the surface of the ground.  The air is unbearably warm and far below lies a smoke-shrouded landscape.  All around you fires rage.  The flames spew ash and smoke into the air, polluting the sky with a thick haze.  A little sunlight leaks through the noxious, immobile haze overhead, but most of the illumination for this strange and hellish land is provided by raging fires.  There is an odd glint in the western portion of the sky that could warrant some attention. Just barely visible through the smoke, a faint outline of a tower, apparently composed of metal, can be made out.  A narrow trail circles down the spire, providing the only exit from here.

rooms.name: The Spire
rooms.description: Climbing along the spire is taxing and movement is slow and treacherous. On the eastern horizon there appears to be a a city which seems to be about a kilometer away.  The city is in the midst of a great fire, and tongues of flames reach high into the air.  Separating the spire from the city is a landscape of broken rock.  Glancing to the north, there is a forest.  Fire reigns supreme there as well, as flames can be seen dancing among the forest heart.  To the south, fire burns broad swaths of destruction through tall prairie grass.  The forest and prairie are both separated from the spire by a chaotic landscape.  From here the trail leads up or down.

rooms.name: The Spire
rooms.description: This appears to be the mid-way point along the spire.  An odd glimmer to the northwest is captivating and all attention is drawin in that direction.  Far away, in an area shrouded by smoke and fumes, there is the hulk of a fiercely burning ship.  The ship shimmers, seeming to phase in and out of reality, before finally collapsing in a cloud of smoke and ash.  When the cloud lifts, all traces of the ship have mysteriously vanished.  Peering into the distance, the area shimmers again, and a blazing wooden tower phases into existence. Perhaps in places where a fire is particularly disastrous or intense, the area temporarily overlaps into the plane of fire and the disaster is recreated here.

rooms.name: Base of the Spire
rooms.description: Here rises a spire composed of a solid gray stone.  The spire juts up from a landscape that is broken and chaotic.  Crevices and irregular mounds of rock make travel difficult and dangerous.  Travel is possible in either of the four compass directions, or exploration of the spire is possible by following a trail which circles up and appears to lead to the apex.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Here stretches a land that is broken and chaotic.  Narrow, deep furrows trace madly across the land, as though the surface of the earth has been gouged by some impossibly large beast.  To the south, a spire of stone thrusts up from the landscape.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by the terrain, but it may be possible to move to the north to further explore this broken land. South will lead to the spire.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Furrows that began to the south widen into crevices here.  Smoke gushes out of the crevices and breathing is becoming difficult in this area.  A spire of stone can be seen rising from the south.  Passage to the west and north is blocked by the terrain, but it is possible to move either east or south to explore this broken land further.

rooms.name: Edge of a Fiery Forest
rooms.description: You are standing at the edge of a great forest.  Heavy, thorny undergrowth blocks entrance to the forest, but there is a path to the north which will provide passage through the woods.  Although the fire cannot be seen, it can be heard raging throughout the forest.  A thud reverberates through the forest as a tall tree, spent of its fuel, crashes to the ground.  A terrain of broken land begins to the south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: The noise made by the fire raging through the forest is still loud but there is a new, much fainter sound coming from the woods.  The sound has an irregular quality reminiscient of a gentle whisper.  Perhaps somewhere in the forest a gentle wind blows, causing limbs and twigs and leaves to move ever so slightly, their collective movements creating the gentle whispers.  The path continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Looming over the path are tall trees.  The trees drape their branches over the trail, and although the air is still, the leaves of these branches quiver slightly, as though caught in a breeze.  You are at a loss to explain this phenomenon.  The path continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Looming over the path are tall trees.  The trees drape their branches over the trail, and although the air is still, the leaves of these branches quiver slightly, as though caught in a breeze.  You are at a loss to explain this phenomena.  The path continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Looming over the path are tall trees.  The trees drape their branches over the trail, and although the air is still, the leaves of these branches quiver slightly, as though caught in a breeze.  You are at a loss to explain this phenomena.  The path continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Trees crowd closely to the trail, as though seeking comfort in this open space.  The whispering is much louder here and perhaps it comes from the trees themselves.  Somehow, this forest has a sort of self-awareness, and the fire raging within its breast has caused a panic among the trees.  The path continues to the north, east, and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Trees crowd closely to the trail, as though seeking comfort in this open space.  The whispering is much louder here and perhaps it comes from the trees themselves.  Somehow, this forest has a sort of self-awareness, and the fire raging within its breast has caused a panic among the trees.  The path continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Peering into the woods, there are flames just beyond a screen of trees to the west.  The flames dance among the trees and seem to be moving in your direction.  There is a sound of rustling from all around, as though the trees were actually shifting and twisting, moving from place to place, in order to avoid the flames.  The path continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: This close to the flames, the fire's full force feels like a dwarven blast furnance.  The heat is as intense as the extreme destruction brought upon this forest by the flames.  Mingled with sounds of the fire's devastation are muffled groans that sound almost like screams.  The trees that contact the fire shake wildly, as though in great pain, but this simply facilitates the fire's proliferation, as embers are tossed from bough to bough.  The path continues to the north and south.

rooms.name: The Holy Shrine
rooms.description: The trail opens up to a natural clearing in the forest.  In the center of the clearing is the knee-high stump of a tree.  Examining the broad base of the stump you determine that the tree was once a fabled Silveroak.  Even after hundreds of years of being exposed to weather, rot and insects, the stump still maintains a slight silver sheen.  It is obvious that the Silveroak's demise was not natural: the scars of axe and sword are still visible upon its base. Trees growing along the perimeter of the clearing blaze brightly.  Several smoldering bodies lie at the edge of the clearing, apparently Druids who expended their lives in a futile effort to end the fire's devastation.  The only exit from the clearing is through a trail to the north.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Trees crowd closely to the trail, as though seeking comfort in this open space.  The whispering is much louder here and perhaps it comes from the trees themselves.  Somehow, this forest has a sort of self-awareness, and the fire raging within its breast has caused a panic among the trees.  The path continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Peering into the woods, there are flames just beyond a screen of trees to the west.  The flames dance among the trees and seem to be moving in your direction.  There is a sound of rustling from all around, as though the trees were actually shifting and twisting, moving from place to place, in order to avoid the flames.  The path continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: Gateway to an Aqueous Realm
rooms.description: A swift stream runs through this section of the forest.  The sound of water rushing over stone is lost in the roar of the fire.  The fire seems undaunted by the water, for trees along the creek's bank burn fiercely.  You follow the creek downstream, hoping that it will lead you to a section of the forest where the flames burn less brilliantly.  As you round a bend in the creek, you come across a shallow pool.  The flames are less evident here and trees surrounding the water are actually unscathed by fire.  Peering into the depths of the pool, there is a Gateway at the very bottom.  Aside from the Gateway, the only other exit is south, back to the main trail.

Down.description: The Gateway is fashioned from a silvery metal that has an almost liquid appearance. Gingerly, you reach out and touch the metal. The metal, strangely enough, yields to your touch, as though it has the consistency of butter; but when you remove your finger, the metal flows and rebounds to its original state. You have no doubt this metal, despite its apparent softness, is virtually indestructible.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Trees crowd closely to the trail, as though seeking comfort in this open space.  The whispering is much louder here and you are forced to conclude that it comes from the trees themselves.  Somehow, this forest has a sort of self-awareness, and the fire raging within its breast has caused a panic among the trees.  The path continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Peering into the woods, there are flames just beyond a screen of trees to the west.  The flames dance among the trees and seem to be moving in your direction.  There is a sound of rustling from all around, as though the trees were actually shifting and twisting, moving from place to place, in order to avoid the flames.  The path continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Looming over the path are tall trees.  The trees drape their branches over the trail, and although the air is still, the leaves of these branches quiver slightly, as though caught in a breeze.  You are at a loss to explain this phenomena.  The path continues to the north, south, and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: Peering into the woods, there are flames just beyond a screen of trees to the west.  The flames dance among the trees and seem to be moving in your direction.  There is a sound of rustling from all around, as though the trees were actually shifting and twisting, moving from place to place, in order to avoid the flames.  The path continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: This close to the flames, the fire's full force feels like a dwarven blast furnance.  The heat is as intense as the extreme destruction brought upon this forest by the flames.  Mingled with sounds of the fire's devastation are muffled groans that sound almost like screams.  The trees that contact the fire shake wildly, as though in great pain, but this simply facilitates the fire's proliferation, as embers are tossed from bough to bough.  The path continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: This close to the flames, the fire's full force feels like a dwarven blast furnance.  The heat is as intense as the extreme destruction brought upon this forest by the flames.  Mingled with sounds of the fire's devastation are muffled groans that sound almost like screams.  The trees that contact the fire shake wildly, as though in great pain, but this simply facilitates the fire's proliferation, as embers are tossed from bough to bough.  The path continues to the west.  All other exits are blocked by walls of fire.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: This close to the flames, the fire's full force feels like a dwarven blast furnance.  The heat is as intense as the extreme destruction brought upon this forest by the flames.  Mingled with sounds of the fire's devastation are muffled groans that sound almost like screams.  The trees that contact the fire shake wildly, as though in great pain, but this simply facilitates the fire's proliferation, as embers are tossed from bough to bough.  The path continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: This close to the flames, the fire's full force feels like a dwarven blast furnance.  The heat is as intense as the extreme destruction brought upon this forest by the flames.  Mingled with sounds of the fire's devastation are muffled groans that sound almost like screams.  The trees that contact the fire shake wildly, as though in great pain, but this simply facilitates the fire's proliferation, as embers are tossed from bough to bough.  The path continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: The woods crackle and pop as fire races through the underbrush.  Flames lick up the sides of trees all around, greedily feeding upon the strength of the wood.  Peering into the flames there seems to be some regularity to its movement.  The flames dance to a rhythm that cannot be heard, jumping from tree to tree, rising and falling to the rules of the dance.  Although fire is simply an element, it is hard to believe that there is not some intelligence guiding its actions.  The path continues to the east and north.

rooms.name: A Fiery Forest
rooms.description: The woods crackle and pop as fire races through the underbrush.  Flames lick up the sides of trees all around, greedily feeding upon the strength of the wood.  Peering into the flames there seems to be some regularity to its movement.  The flames dance to a rhythm that cannot be heard, jumping from tree to tree, rising and falling to the rules of the dance.  Although fire is simply an element, it is hard to believe that there is not some intelligence guiding its actions.  The path continues to the east and north.

rooms.name: Heart of the Forest
rooms.description: This is the very heart of this forest.  The fire burns brightest here, feeding upon the strength of mighty oaks that populate the heart.  In the center of this devastation towers a noble Silveroak.  The legendary tree is much more resilient to fire than its cousins but even it is starting to take fire.  The leaves of the Silveroak are singed and curled, and its bark is blackened from contact with flames.  This is a very dangerous place to be: tall oaks burn like brands here, and they could topple over and onto you at any moment.  You may escape this place by returning to the trail to the south. All other exits are blocked by walls of fire.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: The crevices are numerous here, giving the earth a ragged impression. Flames and smoke emerge from the crevices and you become almost blinded by the heat and gas.  Passage to the east and south is blocked by the terrain, but you may move to either the north or west if you wish to explore this broken land further.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: The land here is crisscrossed by numerous fissures and crevices, marring the earth like scars.  Flames emerge from the largest crevices and dance gleefully along the surface.  Traveling through this area there is a sharp crack and you stumble back in alarm as a crevice suddenly opens under foot.  The crevice extends to the west from your location, tearing through the earth as easily as though it were rotted cloth.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by the terrain, but you may move to either the north or south if you wish to explore this broken land further.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Crevices and fissures mar the surface of the earth.  The fissures are more numerous here than the crevices but begin to widen to the south.  Smoke lies heavily in the air, and burn the eyes causing great pain as you survey your location.  To the north is the edge of a great forest.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by the terrain, but passage south allows for further exploration opportunities in this broken land.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: A stone spire rising from the east is the only object of interest in this landscape.  The land all around is broken by crevices.  The injured earth continues in every direction for as far as the eye can see.  The spire can be reached traveling east, or more of this broken land lies to the south. Passage north and west is blocked by crevices.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: The land here is broken and marred by crevices which race madly through the earth.  The rock itself is brittle and sharp, and displays neither the beauty of the earth nor its strength.  Crevices block travel to the east and south, but there are paths to the west and north.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: All around, crevices tear up the land, obliterating any of the natural beauty that might otherwise have filled this landscape.  Crevices block travel to the north and west, but there are paths that continue to the east and south.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Glance about this landscape there is nothing which is formed of the earth: everything in this land is the product of fire.  Even the basaltic rocks over which you trod have their origin in fire.  Crevices block the path to the east and south, but the path continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Flames leap up from the crevices all around, rising higher and higher, as though competing for attention.  Ignoring the flames and peering into the western horizon, a tower made of some metal, perhaps brass, rises through the smoke and haze.  The tower occasionally glimmers and pulses as it reflects light from the fires around it.  Crevices block the path to the north and south, but the path continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description: A cramped stairwell circles through the brass tower here.  There is little adornment along the stariwell.  To say this part of the tower is Spartan is an understatement.  At the top of the stairwell there appears to be a trapdoor, while the bottom is lost in darkness.

Up.description: The trapdoor is made of copper.

rooms.name: Gateway to a Realm of Earth
rooms.description: Here is a small, barren chamber beneath the brass tower.  The walls and floor of this chamber are made of earth, not metal.  There is an ancient feel to this room that indicates that this place existed long before the tower was built.  On the floor, almost hidden under loose dirt, is a Gateway.  The upper reaches of the brass tower can be reached by climbing the stairwell.

Down.description: The Gateway is fashioned from a silvery metal that has an almost liquid appearance. Gingerly, you reach out and touch the metal. The metal, strangely enough, yields to your touch, as though it has the consistency of butter; but when you remove your finger, the metal flows and rebounds to its original state. You have no doubt this metal, despite its apparent softness, is virtually indestructible.

rooms.name: Before the Tower
rooms.description: A slender tower of brass rises from the broken landscape directly to the west.  The tower is encircled by flames which sporadically leap up, piercing the tower's shroud of smoke and darkness and causing the metal to glimmer in the firelight.  A gate to the west will allow access to the interior of the tower.  A few tubes that resemble drains project out over the gate.  The broken land continues to the east.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: To the south, there lies a wide grassy plain.  Flames rush through the dry grassland in waves, blackening broad swaths of ground.  The terrain underfoot currently has been broken by several fissures.  The fissures block travel to the west and east but the path continues to the north and south.  The spire is north.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Here, close to the grassy plain, the voracious fire can be heard roaring as it sweeps through the dry grassland.  The flames belch smoke and sparks into the air.  The terrain is riddled with fissures.  The fissures block travel to the west and east, but the path continue to the north or south.

rooms.name: Edge of the Grassland
rooms.description: This is the northern edge of a great and seemingly endless prairie.  The power and beauty of the fire as it rages through this area is awe inspiring. As the fire burns it shoots sparks straight into the air.  The sparks ride the heat currents created by the flames, and streak across the sky like shooting stars.  The fires block travel to the west, east, and south, so the only recourse is to return to the north.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: The terrain between the city and the spire is difficult to traverse.  The route has many tall mounds of broken stone which must be surmounted in order to reach the desired destination.  The descent along these mounds is as difficult as the ascent, because the broken rock makes for treacherous footing. Immediately to the west, there is a spire of stone rising high into the air. The city lies to the east.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: Frequent slips and falls are common in this maze of mounds between you and your destination.  When you reach the higher mounds, you must pause briefly to take your bearings and adjust course to your destination.  You may continues west to the spire, or north to the city.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: A maze of rocky mounds surrounds you.  Reaching the peak of one, you see you are midway between the the only landmarks you can see- the stone spire, and the burning city.  As you descend the mound, you lose your footing and slide several meters before managing to halt your progress.  Brushing yourself off, you send a silent prayer to the gods that you were not injured, and continue your journey, mindful to be more careful.  You may continues south to the spire, or east to the city.

rooms.name: The Broken Land
rooms.description: A few mounds of broken rock impede the path here.  You navigate over and around the mounds carefully, and see they become more numerous to the west. Reaching a flat section of the earth, you become aware that the land itself is very warm.  Touching the ground with the palm of your hand, you find that the land is indeed radiating heat, as though the very earth is on fire.  To the east, you see the beginnings of a cobblestone street.  You may also journey west, toward the spire.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: You have arrived at the edge of a city ravaged by fire.  The flames are so intense in some areas that even stone building have become corrupted with fire. As you survey this devastation, a cloud of ash and flame rises suddenly from the east, accompanied by the sound of a wood and stone collapsing.  There are structures, apparently stores, to the north and south, but access to the stores is blocked by impassable walls of fire.  A street, clogged with rubble, continues to the east.  A terrain of broken rock lies to the west.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: Flames rage all around, heating the air, making the environment quite intolerable.  Even the stones beneath under foot are scorching hot.  Stepping quickly through this area, there is a faint sound, a faint wailing sound.  The sound seems to come from all around, increasing in intensity as the moments pass.  You scan for the source of the wail, and out of the flames an elf woman emerges and staggers toward you.  Tears of blood stream freely down her face and land upon the street with a sizzle.  The blood quickly boils away, emitting a cloying stench.  As quickly as she appears, the elf vanishes, but the stench of blood remains as a reminder of her presence.  The street continues to the south, east and west.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: Smoke hangs heavily in the air, obscuring your vision.  Images swirl uncertainly in the smoke and you spend several moments trying to decide whether there is truly something moving beyond the smoke.  As you concentrate on the images, they resolve into the form of elves, apparently rushing about in a panic.  Many of the elves are wounded, and none seem aware of your presence. The street continues to the north, east and south.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: Traveling along the street it seems that the area here has begun to shimmer, as though phasing in and out of reality.  The fire, however, is as real as ever, and rages all about.  The street continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Edge of Oblivion
rooms.description: Traveling through this city, there has been many differnt sounds: the wild rage of the fire, the crack of timber and stone, the wail of the dead. However, sound becomes suddenly muted here, as though the devastation of the city was occurring far away.  Perhaps the fabric of this city is losing its cohesion on this plane.  It may be wise to depart immediately, before being carried with the city into oblivion, doomed to drift endlessly along the currents of space and time.  The street continues to the west.  To the south, the street dissolves into oblivion.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: The smoke is thick here, billowing from several local fires.  Most of the smoke rises into the air and collects about ten meters above.  Glancing up at this artificial cloud, there appears to be movement in the sky.  Suddenly, a great black dragon swoops down from the clouds, talons extended!  As her evil eyes fix upon you, there is a realization of impending doom, but just before the dragon sinks her claws into your belly, she shimmers and disappears.  As the dragon winks out of existence, a guttural voice barks: "No mortal will escape the hunger of Sagece!" Thankfully the path proceeds to the west, east and south.

rooms.name: The Edge of Oblivion
rooms.description: An unnatural quite has descended upon this ruined city.  The flames burn silently, as though they were simple illusions, but when you reach out to touch a flame you discover that is it is indeed hot.  Color is also muted here, and leeches away by the moment.  You understand that the fabric of this area is dissolving, and that if you continue to explore the deeper recesses of the city, you will be carried away into oblivion along with the city, forever lost in time and space.  The street continues to the west, and dissolves into oblivion to the south.

rooms.name: Welcome to Oblivion
rooms.description: Images flicker in and out of existence.  Great cities, ancient forests, and fantastic beasts appear for an instant before being whisked away by the currents of time and space.  You alone are a permanent fixture in the midst of this chaos.

rooms.name: A Shattered City
rooms.description: Two avenues meet here, forming a plaza, with a fountain at the center.  You approach the fountain, which has been shattered by whatever disaster swept through this area, and peer into its depths.  As you watch, horrified, blood wells up from cracks in the bottom of the fountain and overflows onto the cobblestone plaza!  You back away from the growing pool of blood and then, quite suddenly, as though time has run in reverse, the blood recedes back toward the fountain, and disappears soundlessly into the cracks.  You may leave this chaotic and frightening area by traveling north, west or east.

extras.text: The fountain was once beautifully sculpted of marble, but the devastation which has swept through the city has left it a shattered heap. You look for a trapdoor in the base of the fountain but are unable to find one. You must be confusing this city with another city! <grin>

rooms.name: The Sentry Post
rooms.description: The air in the tower is hot and stuffy.  Smoke pours into the tower from a gate to the east and swirls about the chamber before finally rising up a spiral stairwell in the center of the room.  On the floor alongside the stairwell there is a larger copper ring.

rooms.name: The Barracks
rooms.description: A thick gray smoke swirls about the chamber but the smell of the smoke is intermingled with the unmistakable stench of unwashed bodies.  Several beds made of stone, arranged in a strict military fashion, line the sides of this chamber.  A stairwell in the middle of the room continues in a vertical direction.

rooms.name: The Drain Room
rooms.description: A dozen hollow, open-face pipes span the west and east walls here.  The pipes start high to the west, then slant sharply down as they run east.  The pipes continue to extend through the wall to the east.  You are puzzled by this odd arrangement of tubes and decide to investigate further.  In one corner of the room you find several metal barrels.  There is script along the top of the barrels which reads: "Warning!  CONTAINS WATER, handle with extreme caution". As you recall the drains which project over the entrance of this tower, you realize that the pipes lead outside and are an essential element of the defensive plan of this tower.  No doubt that in a world full of flames, water would be the ideal weapon to repel assaults.  A narrow stairwell in the center of the room continues in a vertical direction.

rooms.name: The Warlord's Room
rooms.description: An elaborate map made of stone has been molded into the brass ceiling of this chamber.  The map is difficult to comprehend but it appears this tower marks the eastern edge of the Azer's kingdom.  From this point, the warlord defends the eastern border from the monsters common to this plane.  Aside from the map and a single stone bed, the room is barren.  There is a stairwell in the center of the room leading down.

rooms.name: Gateway to a Realm of Air
rooms.description: The flames are intense here and are whipped around by a stiff breeze.  As you watch, the flames, herded the the wind, swirl together into a cyclone and careen across the street!  As you scuttle away from this deadly firestorm and catch sight of something solid at the very fringe of the storm.  It is a Gateway several meters off the ground and is almost beyond reach.  It may be possible to open the portal and pull yourself through.  The street continues to the west.  All other exits are blocked by walls of fire.

Up.description: The Gateway is fashioned from a silvery metal that has an almost liquid appearance. Gingerly, you reach out and touch the metal. The metal, strangely enough, yields to your touch, as though it has the consistency of butter; but when you remove your finger, the metal flows and rebounds to its original state. You have no doubt this metal, despite its apparent softness, is virtually indestructible.
